name: AzureContentSafetyContentModeration
description: Integrate Azure Content Safety Content Moderation Service to filter out harmful content in AI-generated responses. This guardrail checks for hate speech, sexual content, self-harm, and violence, and can be applied to both requests and responses.

policyAttributes.name: name
policyAttributes.description: The name of the guardrail policy. This will be used for tracking purposes.

policyAttributes.name: hateCategory
policyAttributes.description: The severity level for the hate category.

policyAttributes.name: sexualCategory
policyAttributes.description: The severity level for the sexual category.

policyAttributes.name: selfHarmCategory
policyAttributes.description: The severity level for the self harm category.

policyAttributes.name: violenceCategory
policyAttributes.description: The severity level for the violence category.

policyAttributes.name: jsonPath
policyAttributes.description: Specify the JSONPath expression that identifies the location where prompt decoration should be applied.

policyAttributes.name: passthroughOnError
policyAttributes.description: If enabled, the request or response is passed through without validation when the Azure Content Safety service is unavailable. Otherwise, a guardrail validation error is triggered.

policyAttributes.name: showAssessment
policyAttributes.description: When enabled, the error response will include detailed information about the reason for the guardrail intervention.
